text: Edith Erna Oker (born 1 February 1961 in Stuttgart) is a German former athlete who competed in the sprint hurdles. She represented West Germany at the 1984 Summer Olympics reaching the semifinals. Her personal bests are 13.14 seconds in the 100 metres hurdles (+Los Angeles 1984) and 8.04 seconds in the 60 metres hurdles (Sindelfingen 1984).All-Athletics profile ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=3|1979 |rowspan=3|European Junior Championships |rowspan=3|Bydgoszcz, Poland |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |100 m hurdles |13.70 |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |4x100 m relay |44.84 |- |4th |Long jump |6.26 m |- |1981 |European Indoor Championships |Grenoble, France |8th (h) |50 m hurdles |6.971 |- |1983 |European Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |6th |60 m hurdles |8.21 |- |rowspan=4|1984 |rowspan=2|European Indoor Championships |rowspan=2|Gothenburg, Sweden |6th |60 m |7.42 |- |4th |60 m hurdles |8.14 |- |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Los Angeles, United States |10th (sf) |100 m hurdles |13.37 |- |5th |4x100 m relay |43.57 |- |1985 |European Indoor Championships |Piraeus, Greece |7th (sf) |60 m hurdles |8.12 |- |1986 |European Championships |Stuttgart, West Germany |22nd (h) |100 m hurdles |13.76 |- |1987 |European Indoor Championships |Liévin, France |10th (sf) |60 m hurdles |8.13 |} 1Did not finish in the semifinals ==References== Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:West German female hurdlers Category:Sportspeople from Stuttgart Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of West Germany
